results.title: Ludovic: a crocodile in my garden
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, French Program, Animation Youth Studies, Therese Descary, Jean-Jacques Leduc and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: Ludovic, a young teddy bear organises his origami jungle animals to go on a spring picnic in his garden. The mood degenerates as the animals disobey Ludovic and fight one another. Ludovic retreats inside disappointed, but all is resolved happily when cookies are distributed and the animals learn to share.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, French Program, Animation Youth Studies, Therese Descary, Jean-Jacques Leduc and Co Hoedeman

results.title: Lucy, queen of comedy
results.brief_description: Using archival footage, stills, film excerpts and trailers, and television program footage this video puts together an excellent documentary about the career of one of America’s most loved comedic entertainers and actors, Lucille Ball. From radio to motion pictures to eventually television where Lucy, partnered by her husband Desi Arnaz, starred in what is considered America’s all-time favourite television series, “I Love Lucy”. She has also starred with such actors as Eddie Cantor, the Three Stooges, the Marx Brothers, Bob Hope and Henry Fonda. Narrated by Jeff Lupeton.

results.title: Lucy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”.
Lucy, 21 months and in foster care for 19 days, is too young to carry a clear image of the absent mother and readily accepts her foster mother’s care. The film shows in dramatic fashion the conflict of emotions that Lucy experiences when required to leave her foster mother’s care even though she is happy to return to her natural mother.

results.title: Lucrezia Borgia
results.brief_description: Gaetano Donizetti’s opera “Lucrezia Borgia”, based on the play by Victor Hugo, is a story of love and intrigue set in 16th Century Italy. A young man, Gennaro, meets the despised Lucrezia Borgia (Joan Sutherland) and is attracted to her. Lucrezia’s husband, Alfonso, is jealous and plots his revenge on Gennaro. Just before he dies from poisoning, Lucrezia tells Gennaro that she is his mother. She too drinks poison and dies with him. A superb performance by the Australian Opera, directed by George Ogilvie and conducted by Richard Bonynge, and featuring the wonderfully rich voice of Joan Sutherland - this is a must for opera fans. Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on July 8, 1977 and sung in Italian.

results.title: Lucretia: a poem by Peter Desbarats
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Eunice Macaulay and Heidi Blomkvist
results.brief_description: Bright, impish Lucretia is a perfect angel in her homeland, Hell, where good is frowned upon. One Christmas Eve she uses her magical powers to pass through the forbidden gate. Seeking Christmas throughout the galaxies, she finds the planet Earth and an old man’s snowy yard. The combined knowledge, yearning and powers of Lucretia and the old man produce a memorable Christmas celebration. Based on a poem by Peter Desbarats.

results.title: Luckytown blues
results.brief_description: Fleeing her trailer trash mother, 18 year old Lidda (Kirsten Dunst) calls into a video store to invite a guy she has seen from afar on a road trip with her to Las Vegas. Colonel (Vincent Kartheiser) begrudgingly accompanies her after he is left with no choice when she saves his life. Predictable bickering ensues and the two are destined for romance, especially when circumstance continues to pit them together. Las Vegas is a dazzling, sleazy, drug infested milieu populated by scantily clad women, prostitutes, and is home to Lidda’s estranged professional poker playing father (James Caan) with whom she seeks a reunion. In Vegas Lidda and Colonel do what it takes to survive: Colonel with gambling, Lidda with stripping, as they become embroiled in the dangerous world of her father in seeking answers at a crossroad in her life. Cast also includes: Luis Guzman, Robert Miano, Jennifer Gareis, Theresa Russell.

results.title: Lucky Luciano
results.creator_credit: Harbor Productions, VIDES Cinematografica, Les Films de la Boetie, Franco Cristaldi and Francesco Rosi
results.brief_description: Inspired by real life events, ‘Lucky Luciano’ follows the infamous crime boss (Gian Maria Volonte) from the time he was pardoned after serving nine years of his 50-year sentence in the 1930s and 1940s, to his deportation to Italy. Once in Italy, Luciano is jailed for 10 years by narcotics investigator Charles Siragusa (playing himself in the film) who is trying to bring down a drug smuggling empire going from strength to strength. With ‘Lucky Luciano’ Rosi returns to his favourite theme, the connections between legal and illegal exercises of power (already present in films such as ‘Hands over the City’, also starring Rod Steiger). Rosi exposes the entanglement of the CIA and mob heroin-mongers during and in the years following World War II. Cast includes Edmund O’Brien, Charles Siragusa, Rod Steiger and Vincent Gardenia. The Italian-speaking actors are dubbed in English. Reference: San Francisco International Film Festival (1997). http://www.sfiff.org/festivals/1997/thefilms/html/bymaker_82.html

results.title: Lucky 13 = Xianu shisan mei
results.creator_credit: Beijing Film Studio, Tsuji Optical Laboratories, Yang Qitian and Toru Muragawa
results.brief_description:
This is a revenge story taking place in the Qing Dynasty. Miss He Yufeng’s father is a junior officer who offended Minister Ji Xiantang for refusing Ji’s son’s proposal to marry his daughter, Yufeng. Yufeng’s parents were killed by Ji but she narrowly escaped. Yufeng learns kung-fu from a kung-fu master and swears to revenge. After years of practice, Yufeng becomes a kung-fu master and plans to assassinate the Minister. Before she leaves, Yufeng’s master gave her a name, Lucky 13 (or: Sister 13) as ‘Yu’ consists of ‘ten’ and ‘three’. Yufeng’s assassination attempt failed and Minister Ji also hired a kung-fu master, Iron Monk, to protect him. In the meantime, Yufeng met a young and handsome scholar, Mr. An. Yufeng fell in love with An and risked her life to save An, who was robbed by bandits. Yufeng disguised herself as a dancer and killed Minister Ji finally. At the end of the film, Yufeng leaves her swear brothers, who helped her to revenge, and goes to find Mr. An. This is an interesting film that defies the stereotypical image of traditional Chinese women who are normally portrayed as subordinates of men.

The story of Lucky 13 is popular in Hong Kong, Taiwan and China and has different film and TV versions. For example, the Hong Kong TVB produced a 20 episodes TV series of Lucky 13 in 1983. The heroine of the film, DING Lan is a very well-known actress in China. She starred in The Shaolin Temple (1982) with Jet Li and played a couple of leading roles in other martial arts films as well. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beijing Film Studio, Tsuji Optical Laboratories, Yang Qitian and Toru Muragawa

results.title: Lucky
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and John Goldschmidt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
A boy of 18 re-enacts the way he left his home in Devon and went to London, without money but with high hopes. There he keeps alive cadging and stealing. He takes drugs and is eventually taken to hospital after collapsing on the street. Following this, he is put in touch with the Department of Social Security who help in his rehabilitation.
